sentences.en: As with handwritten letters, electronic communications have also tended to supplant actual spoken conversations with others.
sentences.cn: 如同手写信件一样, 电子通信也有让人们减少面对面交谈的倾向.

sentences.en: Barker was soon supplanted as party leader.
sentences.cn: 巴克在党内的领导地位很快就被人取代了。

sentences.en: Even the attempts to supplant it pay IQ the tribute of accepting its frame of reference.
sentences.cn: 甚至各种取代“智商”的尝试也都以它作为参照.

sentences.en: It is my view that the new historical disciplines complement rather than supplant traditional history.
sentences.cn: 我认为这些新的历史学科对传统历史学起到了补充而非排挤作用.

sentences.en: The duke plotted to supplant the king.
sentences.cn: 公爵阴谋取代国王的地位.

sentences.en: The law of momentum conservation could supplant Newton's third law.
sentences.cn: 动量守恒定律可以取代牛顿第三定律.

sentences.en: The steam engine began to supplant the muscular power of men and animals.
sentences.cn: 蒸汽机开始取代人和动物的劳动.

sentences.en: TV and computers shouldn't supplant time with others and cyber chats don't develop social skills.
sentences.cn: 电视和电脑不应取代与他人共度的时光,而且,网上聊天并不能提高社交技巧.

trans.tran_en: to take the place of a person or thing so that they are no longer used, no longer in a position of power etc
to take the place of a person or thing so that they are no longer used, no longer in a position of power etc
